The people who complained about it being blurry are so retarded. This is an image taken down to microarcseconds. Just a few millionths of one degree. 1 arcsecond Is the equivelent to an object a few hundred meters away being about 1 millimeter wide. So one microarcsecond is 1 millionth of that. This object is incredibly tiny compared to the mass. It is about 120 arc units wide. Considering the distance that is very hard to resolve. Given we can now resolve the arctic disc in reasonable detail too is astonishing. Any other telescope would resolve the collective light, but only one can separate the black hole from the accretion disc.

Technically the black hole isn’t really there because we’re seeing 50 million years back in time. At the very moment what the black hole is doing to our galaxy is a complete mystery that’ll be solved in this very moment but 50 million years later. In other words, everything’s a lie.

Black hole explained, Imagine a pressure That permeates the entire universe, even before anything exist, Some called this pressure dark matter or the field but the original name was the Aether, Now imagine 2 physical objects some distance apart from each other within this pressure call Aether, space or the void,
These 2 objects will have an infinite pressure point from all directions, except form between each other, Because there will only be a finite amount of pressure between 2 objects,
This low pressure point between 2 objects will cause them to accelerate towards one another, or better put towards the lowest pressure point between each other, As they move towards each other, the pressure drops, lower and lower, which is the cause of acceleration, The low pressure points between two objects is also in truth a black hole, It isn’t a hole, just a low pressure point. Between every Physical object, small or big, is a finite Low pressure point, now imagine a galaxy with millions of stars and planets and a low pressure point between every one of them, and in the center of this cluster will be the lowest pressure point called a black hole,That’s why you have a supermassive black hole in the center of every galaxy,

Allow me the doubt. How can that be a black hole? According to the currently accepted theory, a star that is so close to a black hole should be affected by the event horizon effect. This means that the portion of the star closest to the black hole should rotate more and more slowly, while its outermost portion should rotate more rapidly (compared to the closest one). Basically, you should have an elongation of the star with a noticeable trail. I don't see any such effect in the image that justifies there is a black hole in the middle, even in case there were more stars close to the black hole. Either that, or the model that defines the black hole is wrong. This is yet another proof that cosmology is no longer a science since the introduction of the theory of relativity, as it takes the opposite path to the scientific method, which should be: observation, analysis and definition of the theory, and not the contrary.

Fun fact: the image that we see is activity from the black hole from 50 million years ago.

One lightyear is the distance that light would travel in one year.
If an object ten lightyears away dissaprars, the light it emitted is still traveling through space. Looking at it from our perspective, the moment that light disappears from that object would be a moment we'd be witnessing from ten years ago.

To see this in action, you and a friend will need to go to a large field and each of you need to stand at the farthest corners from each other. If you're friend kicks a ball, the sound will be slightly delayed because the sound emitted from the ball being kicked takes time to get to your eardrums. Because light has a constant "speed", the same principle can be applied.

In the same way our ears interpret sound that has travelled to them, or eyes can only interpret the light that has travelled to them.

Why are they talking about black holes and claiming that they took a picture of one? I think this is another public relation fraud. First of all, black hole has zero size, finite mass. Event horizon has finite size. Looking from far away, the effect on gravity from a black hole and a neutron star should be the same, indistinguishable. So, this image is by no means the evidence of the existence of black hole, period. Black hole means a real object with an infinite density (= finite mass/zero size). This picture does not prove that.

2: Another set of assumptions might lead us to posit a huge electromagnetic toroid.
3: At a distance of 50 or so million light years, it might be the biggest bonfire ever, especially since astronomers' distance measurements are not to be believed, after their decades-long idea that "redshift means recession rate at invalid distance".

Every celestial object we see in the sky, pretty much with the exception of the moon, is a portrait of the past. For instance, when you look at stars, you are looking into the past, seeing what they looked like that many (light) years ago. In fact, with our own star the same principle holds. You can never see the sun where it actually is in the sky. It is eight light minutes away from us (93,000,000 miles), and since you are seeing it where it was 8 minutes ago, its actual position in the sky due to earth's rotation has moved it roughly four solar diameters from where we see its image. That means that the sun is actually "up" eight minutes before we see it rise, and "down" eight minutes before we see it set.

Black holes cannot be directly seen, but astrophysicists continue to maintain that they exist because of their putative effects. They assume that matter can accelerate and compress until it is “spaghettified”, or stretched, whereupon it is torn apart and reconfigured by intense gravity fields.

Almost all (more than 95%) of galaxies are thought by astronomers to be home to one or more black holes. Since matter spins around a black hole at extreme velocities, consensus opinions state that it heats up from friction, generating X-rays and ultraviolet light. It is those emissions that are interpreted as indirect evidence for black holes.

Previous Pictures of the Day take issue with that model. The terminology, itself, is highly speculative and ambiguous. To say that X-rays and ultraviolet light are created in gravity fields is to betray an ignorance. Experiments in the laboratory create those energies by accelerating charged particles in an electric field.

There is no experiment that can provide evidence for matter collapsed to “near infinite density”. Rather, Bennet pinches (z-pinches) in plasma-state material form plasmoids. When the electric flux inside double layers within galactic circuits gets too high, there is a sudden “short circuit” that draws energy from the surrounding space. That energy could be concentrated from hundreds of cubic light years and then discharged in a burst of cosmic lightning, generating X-rays or flares of ultraviolet light.

Instead of a black hole, X-ray radiation from a plasmoid in the Milky Way’s heart is a charged particle accelerator, so electrons spiral in the electromagnetic fields and give off X-rays. The diffuse currents then flow out of the poles and back toward the galaxy’s equatorial plane, spiraling back toward the core.

There is no evidence that matter can collapse to “near infinite density” under gravity’s influence. Black holes are phantoms that can never be observed, since their so-called “event horizons” are impenetrable, allowing no direct observations. No light can escape, so they are invisible at any wavelength. They are pure theory, and have no basis for existence in the natural world.

Black holes are the subject of many previous Picture of the Day articles. The short story, from an Electric Universe perspective, is that black holes are a misperception. The descriptive terminology used by researchers is problematic, relying on loose interpretations. Ambiguous lexical labels such as space/time, singularities, infinite density, and other non-quantifiable ideas, make what should be realistic investigations into a kind of irony.

Using the concept of infinity is all over the work on black holes: infinitely weak gravity is compared to infinitely dense black holes. Such ideas mask the fact that no scientist understands gravity, or how mass is expressed by matter, or how matter expresses gravity. They especially ignore the Electric Universe.

Since stars are plasma phenomena, they are governed by electricity and not by gravity, alone. Since stars are loads in an externally powered circuit, a drop in circuit power means a drop in output, so a star will disappear—it enters a dark mode state. Variations in electric power mean variations in how a star behaves.

Astronomers believe gravity is their only tool, and, in their world, no force can stop the collapse of any mass great enough to form a black hole. However, gravity’s effect is so small that it is effectively non-existent when compared to the electric force. It is charge separation that holds stars together, preventing their collapse. Even thermonuclear fires are not needed for a star to “live”. The standard model of stars fails because gravity is the wrong tool.

Whoa! Calm down. No need to move a thing. It's millions of light years away in distance, so what we're seeing is it as it was millions of years ago in time. If it vanished today, now, at this very minute, or exploded or got eaten by a giant floaty space aardvark, we'd not know about it for millions of years either. Light travels s-o-o-o slowly... We are talking serious latency here. It's a new image, yes, but it's a snapshot of a very, very, very old portrait.

That black hole will look WAY different now. Taller, a bit fatter, maybe starting to lose its hair, and it's probably got one of those cool little beards like Frank Zappa.

So it doesn't matter that it's nearly pointing at us. Ooh, scary. Big shiny space torch beam - Ah, no. Can't hurt us. Can't do a darn thing. It's a space wuss. Yawn.

And as for the future - well, there's no need to move. Assuming the human race is still around in millions of years [highly doubtful; those giant floaty space aardvarks will devour us all!], galactic drift would have moved the planet billions of miles out of the way anyhoooo. A composite image from 8 telescopes.
8 pixels is what they actually captured of this object. 8 tiny pieces of a gigantic, distant object. From those 8 pixels they used algorithms to guess what the rest looked like. Like a giant mosaic... a puzzle, where they only had 8 random pieces. From those, they guessed what the total puzzle looked like. I don't know the total sum of pixels, etc., but at least 95% of that images is an artistic rendition of a black hole, created with an algorithm, which they fed their own images (puzzle pieces) to choose from.

unless based on fact, when it comes to what something is and isn't factually established on its identity, should always remain fluidic and rainbow to the possibilities of what it could be, and should not be on the basis of belief/faith and the stead fast assumption of a theory that paints things black and white and solid, theoretical pre-identification is not only a boring way of going about things, but a dangerous way too.


so put as examples of solid fact vs fact/fiction/theory

1. solid fact: a factual statement of identity of a picture, would be, if someone were to take a picture of an apple, and labeled it, an apple, and a fruit, it is a fact that it is a fruit, and a fact that it is an apple, what color is it, we see that it in this case, happens to be a green apple, based on the average person's ability to perceive colors, there for, factually, it is a green apple and a fruit, how did we come to these facts and conclusions, through years of tangible studying and establishment of facts based purely around those tangible studies, when we gained the ability to study an apple, we gave our self the ability to make and gain fact, from fact, and eventually established the ability to identify green apples and them being a part of a fruit type, there for its not up to debate what it is, it is already solidified as fact.



2. Fact/Fiction/Theory: A factual/factious/theoretical statement of the identity of a picture, would be, if someone were to take a picture, like what we have here, of a celestial body in space, factually, we know, that its a picture, and that it is a celestial body, but as soon as it leaves those two facts, is when you get into the territory of fiction and theory, since there is no factual or tangible study to gain a factual understanding and identity to the picture of said celestial body, it leaves the fact of what the celestial body into a fluidic state of possibility, there for, any possibility we come up with is fiction/theory based solely on the fact that we have no real way yet of obtaining tangible studies of said celestial body, there for anything we come up with, will never be fact, there for a solid identity can never be made, nor can a popular one, it will remain fictional and theoretical no matter what until the proper tangible studies and in science vessel surveys are conducted, required by solid fact, to make anything solid to begin with, there for the attempts to pre-solidly identify something, is not only futile and pointless, but flawed and narrow minded as well.


in conclusion, the only healthy science is fluidic science, theory numbs minds and narrows them, to such a degree that people will do illogical things like believing pre-identification as fact, and taking their theories with faith as if it is a religion dogma and cult, as opposed to keeping themselves open to the possibilities and fluidic in nature.

the instant and stead fast nature of people attempting to set a pre-identified belief on what this is by going as far as to say without a shadow of a doubt is something they think it is, is very disturbing to me, and i dislike the route that human's main stream science is going, it feels less like a science and more like a cult now, and cults and notorious for being black/white, 2 dimensional, and non-fluidic, there for my comparison is justified.

unsurprisingly and extremely consistently, when humans go into looking for specific things, with a bias in mind, the first thing they find that generally looks like the thing they are looking for, they raise the alarms, raise it up as if its the proof that their god exists, and do this exact attempt at biased pre-identification

there are many times in history where humans have done this exact thing, for many different things and places in history, in both science and social and war aspects, i would be writing an entire book, if i wrote down every time humans pre-identified something because of a bias in their minds, that would have led to an inevitable negativity that happened in the world directly because of it.


point is, pre-identification has hurt, not only science but the world, society, technology, and humans over all.

From Ben Becker: The project to take a single (still blurry) picture of a black hole 55 millions years away cost $60 million dollars. There is no immediate profit to be made from the discovery. In fact, it could not have happened if these scientists had to justify their research on the basis of future commodities to be sold on the market, if they were beholden to private investors and quarterly earnings reports. It required social and public funding to liberate science from the boundaries/fetters of profit. Or it would not have happened. Nor could it have happened without profound international coordination (including with Russians and Chinese scientists!)

You see what I'm getting at.

While we can take pictures of previously unseeable things, 55 million light years away, global capitalism can't figure out how to get all the abundance of food into the world's hungry bellies, all the homeless into the empty homes, and how to guarantee the conditions of existence as social rights. Because there's no profit to be made there -- quite the contrary. Our economies are bound by the profit motive and the systems of production, distribution, research and technology are controlled by corporations. So these massive social problems are widely considered natural, permanent, unsolvable. The UN declared them as Millennial Development Goals to be reached by 2015. All the countries signed up; they had celebrations and press conferences. But they failed to reach them. The people remained hungry. The rich got richer. All because of the boundaries of the profit system.

Albert Einstein, whose theory of general relativity led to the theory of black holes -- as the only way to resolve otherwise unresolvable physics problems — was also a socialist. He saw then, a full century ago, that there was more than enough for humanity to provide for the needs of the people if the economy were simply reorganized. A century later the black hole theory has entered into the world of reality, while his plain observation that we can have a world without hunger, homelessness and poverty remains "theoretical."

That theory too can be made real. The scientists who made this breakthrough did so because they devoted their lives to it; it was not a passing interest that they focused on here and there. It will take a lot of dedication, hard work, trial, error and sacrifice to make our next, great collective "breakthrough for humanity." No one needs an advanced degree to join. All that is required to join is a desire to end humanity's needless suffering and to remove the shackles placed on us by the lords of profit and their system.

Why is nobody talking about that this is NOT an actual image, being radio-telescopes which receive radio waves from astronomical radio sources? The radio waves are focused there. At the focal point, the radio waves enter a sensitive receiver. The receiver amplifies the waves and converts them into a signal that can be stored in a computer. Astronomers use computers to turn this information into pictures. So, although it's hugely impressive, and no one has done this before and it's break trough in history, it's not an actual image as those from optical telescopes!

Caveat:    None of this 'confirms' in any way, shape or form whether there actually is such a thing as a true 'black hole', i.e. a naked singularity. There are some very good - scientific - reasons to think that such things (naked singularities) are simply not real physical entities (i.e. not the least of which is the violation of several fundamental principles of physics..and, of course, reason itself). Still, the pic is, well, what it is...whatever it actually is, i.e. possibly a 'grey hole'..that is a highly condensed state of matter with massive gravitational field, but stopped short of singularity by quantum effects etc)...We just don't know. Typical, then, that the mainstream astronomy community simply doubles down by claiming 'this is proof'...The question still remains: proof of exactly what..Certainly, our present lack of understanding of the actual physics of alleged 'black holes' is ...very real, i.e. the failure, to this point, to meld General Relativity (from which 'black holes' derive) with Quantum Mechanics. Until that is achieved, no theory, repeat no theory of 'black holes' is self-consistent.

It is in fact IMPOSSIBLE to photograph a black hole, because light can't escape it's gravitational pull. The image is a computer rendering of the radio telescope arrays detection of the celestial objects surrounding the alleged black hole. It is circumstantial evidence of the existence of a black hole. The glowing doughnut shaped object in the image is the event horizon and not the black hole itself. No one has yet produced an image of an actual black hole, but this is the closest yet.

One light year = 9.461 x 10e12 kms

technically this distance in km is the distance travelled by light(photons) in a year time i.e approx 365 days.

So this black hole being 55 million light years away means 55 million times the above distance in km.

So technically photons had to travel which travels at its own so called speed of light for 55 mil years to reach to the eyes of the telescope for it to capture the image .

Since we all know it’s the light which reaches our retinas which then is processed by our Brain is how we see things.

Hence this “isn’t “ an image of the Black hole. But more aptly it “was”. Technically 55 million years ago.

P.S. universe is constantly expanding and even celestial objects like galaxies are moving.. so it could be that exactly at this point the Black hole would be at be much different place or distance.

DID YOU JUST SAID COMING TOWARD US?

Space is scary. Existence is scary. Why are we born without any existential guardians, when apparently existential threats are all around us. There's no equivalent to nature that protects us against nature itself... and why is nature so against us? Why does that have to be the way things are? We explain it with "the circle of life" but kf you can imagine a reality where one doesn't have to kill the other to survive, why can't it be made into a reality. Surely somewhere across the universe, there's a planet with plenty of natural food, so the creatures aren't forced to fight eachother, and any intelligent life can coexist without having to fight for survival. But we have a nature that's violent and unmerciful. A hurricane eats away entire islands, a lion kills the antelope to survive... why must we rely on death so we can live, only to die so something else can live? Existence is just draining life from other beings until ours is in turn drained or snuffed out. It feels like anything in the universe at any time could just swat the earth at any moment and end everything for us, why is it right that sny otherworldly consciousness that nature or the universe might have wouldn't care less about our extinction if that happened? That's a lonely and helpless feeling. With everything working against us, just existence is a fight. Money seems to almost be a mystical object in this world when it comes to day to day life, but really we're all just stuck on the same planet that at any time could burn, freeze, or break at any moment out of apparently nowhere. I guess we live happily because what's the alternative? Get crushed beneath the weight of the burdens we take on by surviving an ultimately pointless battle, or use what little control we have over our own fate to live our dreams before inevitably losing. We can conjure up all the resources we have to make our lives our own, and the biggest reason to do so and why... is why not. There's a choice we have to make. Even if happiness is a lie, it's a lie worth spreading. If we're all going to the same place, the road of travelers that believe they're going to paradise might enjoy the journey a little more than the road of travelers that believe they're going into a black hole. Maybe they both know there's nothing at the end, but one road makes that decision for the sake of rebelling against nature, our natural sworn enemy. A beautiful, seductive, rich enemy. But in the grand scheme of things, an enemy all the same. So why not choose how the story of the fight is told.

I have a theory on what would happen if someone attempted to enter a black hole:
Due to the black hole's gravitational field, an object would get spaghettified. (Many people know this.) However, instead of actually entering the black hole, an object would be stretched, ripped apart, and its atoms would be spread evenly around the event horizon of the black hole. This could also be why QUAZARS "escape" from the black hole. This gas doesn't really escape, because the atoms are distributed around the black hole. However, this gas is super heated, giving it so much energy and angular momentum that it can't actually impact the black hole. Instead, the gas is focused towards the poles of the black hole (think of the ice skater as she pulls her arms in) and is ejected away from the black hole on a straight path.
So the shadow is roughly the size of our solar system, and the plasma outside that diameter is orbiting with a period of ~2 days? Mind-bogglingly cool.

For those who don't know why this is important and necessary:

The existence of black holes has never been proven--regardless of their popular acceptance in the scientific community--which is why having a physical image of the existence of one can help prove the existence of black holes; this is merely a technical issue with black holes being real. The research that was previously conducted to prove black holes exist could only provide 'hints' of their existence; hints are not proof.

Having an image of its existence is one form of proof, but from a technical standpoint it may not serve as valid proof to some--or even the theory itself--enough to truly prove their existence.

Food for thought: In your bedroom you see a doorway in the wall. Beyond that is pitch black - no light at all. In your experience this doorway is where a closet would normally be located. By observing the door frame, have you proven that a closet lies beyond? You can't see beyond the door frame, so the only thing for certain is that there is a door frame in your bedroom wall - what lies beyond in the darkness is still pure speculation. It might be a closet - very likely a closet, but you haven't proved that it is by observing the door frame. NOTE: The dark region in the image is due to the lack of radio waves, not visible light. The image is not what you would see if you approached M87 unless you can see microwave radio energy .

calculation of 1 light year:
one light year is the distance traveled by the light in 365.25 days. Thus,
1 year is 365.25 days.
1 day is 24 hour
1 hour is 60 minute
1 minute is 60 second
thus, 365.25*24*60*60 is 31557600 second.
Now, we know that,
distance is velocity times time
c=299792458 m/s
Hence, 1 light year is 299792458*31557600, which would be 9.4607304725808e+15
and approximately
1 light year is 9.4607 trillion km

I'm sorry, but... no. Merely taking a picture of an object does not tell you what that object is. Now I want to be careful as I'm not saying that there isn't something at the center of galaxies that is immensely powerful and doing tons of astronomically amazing things. because there quite obviously (as in observed evidence) is, However, simply seeing it does NOT ...
1) tell us "What" it is, nor
2) "How" it functions nor even,
3) "Why" it is.

You can call me crazy, that's fine, but with the massive lack of understanding of electrical systems spanning galactic and intergalactic spaces, I'm still skeptical as to the offers of our CURRENT explanations for the "What", "How", and "Why" questions of what is actually going on in the center of galaxies.

Something that confuses me about light around the event horizon:


If light just outside the event horizon still travels at c, with the only effect being an increased wavelength, then why do we assume that light inside the event horizon suddenly stops obeying the rule "light always travels at c".


I mean, the speed of light basically ignores the pull of the black hole right up as far as the event horizon, why should it suddenly stop travelling at c, just because the gravitational pull is a tiny bit larger?


Are we ABSOLUTELY sure that light doesn't escape from black holes? Maybe it does, but it just has a really, really, long, undetectable, wavelength. Or maybe it just blends in with the CMB?


Like, we know that gravity doesn't effect the actual speed of light, only its wavelength and frequency, right? Granted it can bend light, so most likely a lot of light does get bent back into the black hole, if it's travelling at an angle, but what about light travelling directly out, perpendicular to the black hole?

Pulsars are rotating neutron stars. Most neutron stars discovered today are in the form of radio pulsars. They are called radio pulsars because they emit radio waves. We can simply connect a radio telescope to a loud speaker and hear a pulsar. Pulsars sound like someone persistently knocking.

The Quran describes a star by "The one who knocks":

[Quran 86.1-3] And the heaven and the "Knocker" (Tarek in Arabic طارق) How could you know about the "Knocker"? The piercing star (Thakeb in Arabic).

The Arabic word "Thukb ثقب" means a hole; "Thakeb ثَّاقِبُ" means the one who makes the hole. The Quran is describing a knocking star that makes a hole.

Pulsars are rotating neutron stars. As more matter falls into a neutron star its mass increases and as its mass increases its gravity increases. But gravity is actually curvature of spacetime. A neutron star distorts spacetime. As more matter falls into a neutron star its distortion increases. A point will be reached where distortion would have grown so much that it makes a hole in spacetime.

How could a normal man who lived 1400 years ago have known that pulsars make holes in spacetime?

This doesn't prove any "Black Hole" theory. All it shows is a heavily processed composite image of a high-energy event with massive plasma emission. Simplicity dictates to look for events in physics that can resemble this effect, and plasma discharge effects like Z-Pinches or Double Layer explosions easily can lead to the effect the image shows; plus they're based on solid physics provable in laboratory experiments.
Thus, they falsify with no effort any "Black Hole" theory regarding the observation.

"It takes aroud two days for the plasma to complete one orbit."

Let's do some calculations. Mass of this Black Hole is around 6,5 billion times the mass of the Sun, so around 1.3×10^40 kg. It translates to Schwarzshild's Radius (radius of the sphere enclosed in Event Horizon) of about 2x10^13 meters.
The closest stable orbit of the matter in acrection disk is 3 times the Schwarzilds Radius, so 6×10^13 meters, thus resulting in it's circumference of about (rounding pi down to 3) 3,6×10^14 meters, which translates to 1,2×10^6 light seconds or a little less than 14 light days.

So light needs about 14 days to complete one orbit, yet the matter / plasma in the acrecion disk makes it in 2 days?

"If there should really exist in nature any bodies, whose density is not less than that of the sun, and whose diameters are more than 500 times the diameter of the sun, since their light could not arrive at us; or if there should exist any other bodies of a somewhat smaller size, which are not naturally luminous; of the existence of bodies under either of these circumstances, we could have no information from sight; yet, if any other luminous bodies should happen to revolve about them we might still perhaps from the motions of these revolving bodies infer the existence of the central ones with some degree of probability, as this might afford a clue to some of the apparent irregularities of the revolving bodies, which would not be easily explicable on any other hypothesis; but as the consequences of such a supposition are very obvious, and the consideration of them somewhat beside my present purpose, I shall not prosecute them any further."

Don't believe the hype.
You cannot see or have an image of a black hole, by definition. RADIO telescopes do not detect LIGHT /plasma beams. These are mm radio telescopes, whereas visible light is from 400 to 700nm, with IR being about 1000nm (1 mm). What is being represented is what is purported to be an event horizon of said black hole coupled with MASS EJECTION . What it is showing is EJECTIONS of highly heated particles (not light) coming out of supposed black hole and image is a representation of the IR heat signature given off by those ESCAPING particles.
How can particles escape a black hole? Theory says they cannot.
Other alternative explanations for the phenomena are available, which I think more plausible than this science fairytale feel good news item.

It's important to remember that this isn't an image of a black hole, it's an image of the accretion disk around a black hole. It's still very exciting and impressive, and I don't want to detract from the accomplishment, but the two are very different things and this is science and whatnot so details count.
What you would see if you were actually in the vicinity and seeing the black hole itself would be a couple orders of magnitude cooler and stranger. Though, being that active, it might be very difficult to get a good look at the hole itself even if in the neighborhood. It might be a lot more interesting to see our own smaller but more accessible one up close.

According to site of event horizon telescope (https://eventhorizontelescope.org/science) write the above text: "Similarly, for the EHT, the data we take only tells us only a piece of the story, as there are an infinite number of possible images that are perfectly consistent with the data we measure. But not all images are created equal— some look more like what we think of as images than others. To chose the best image, we essentially take all of the infinite images that explain our telescope measurements, and rank them by how reasonable they look. We then choose the image (or set of images) that looks most reasonable.
Using these algorithms we are able to reconstruct pictures from the very sparse measurements measured with the EHT. Below is a sample reconstruction done using simulated data generated from only 7 telescopes located around the world, and pretending to point at the black hole in the center of our own Milky Way galaxy. Although this is just a simulation, reconstructions such as this give us hope that we soon will be able to to reliably take the first picture of the black hole. "

The images we see are reconstructed. The actual info that was obtained was the twisting dots. But of course that info was interpreted into the fuzzy images they released.

I say again, those aren't images we captured. What we "Saw" didn't look like that. We saw points we were able to track, twisting in space.

It's frustrating to me that actual info is interpreted and that interpretation is then taken as evidence. The actual Data recieved could still represent different things but it's our confirmation bias that wants to see a black hole.

All I'm saying is an interpretation of the data could be wrong. And I feel it's very misleading to create images from information recieved and take that as the actual image, it's not. It's like a police drawing of a suspect from testimony of eye witness. Yeah, technically details are right but the finished product could look like something completely different. Proper science holds on to the data and makes sure it doesn't apply to multiple things. Only when you rule out every other possibility can you actually say it is something definitively.

And to that I say the DATA that was obtained could still represent something else.

BLACK HOLES MENTIONED IN HOLY QURAN!!!

PULSARS AND BLACK HOLES

Neutron stars are remnants of exploded stars. As more matter falls into a neutron star, its mass increases; and as its mass increases, its gravity increases. A point will be reached where gravity would have grown so much, that not even light could escape, thus a black hole forms.

Most neutron stars discovered today are in the form of radio pulsars. They are called radio pulsars because they emit radio waves. We can simply connect a radio telescope to a loud speaker and hear a pulsar. Pulsars sound like someone persistently knocking. In short, we can hear a pulsar knock; and if matter continues to fall into this pulsar, a black hole will eventually form.

Muslims claim that this is what Allāh (ﷻ) says in the Qur`ān. The Qur`ān describes a star by “The one who knocks” and says, that it is “The one who makes a hole”.

❝By the heaven and the “Knocker” (ṭāriq in Arabic)
How could you know about the “Knocker”?
The piercing star (thāqib in Arabic)]❞
― Al-Qur`ān, sūrah al-Ṭāriq (The Nightly Visitor), Chapter 86, Verses 1-3

The Arabic word “Thukb” means a hole; “thāqib” means the one who makes the hole. The Qur`ān is describing a knocking star that makes a hole.

Allāh (ﷻ) swears by the celestial bodies that are invisible, that move, that sweep:

❝I swear by those that are invisible (Khunnas خنس),
that move, that sweep]❞
― Al-Qur`ān, sūrah al-Takwīr (The Winding Up), Ch 81, V 15-16

Shayṭān (Satan) is invisible and is described in Arabic as “Khannas” in the Qur`ān, al-Nās (Humans), Chapter 114, verse 4. The Qur`ān uses the same word “Khunnas” to describe the celestial bodies that are invisible. All celestial bodies have gravity and can sweep everything in their way, but the only ones that are invisible are blackholes.

Our sun is a very small star. Our solar system (including the atoms that you are made of), came from a dying star 100 times more massive than our sun. Some stars are even bigger than our solar system, so one can imagine how large stars are.

The colors shown around the black hole however are just an interpretation. The image was created using radio waves and not visible light waves. They had to then shift the radio wave frequencies to be within the range visible by our eye. And that means that you could pick any color to represent it. So the real question is, what colors are in the real image? I doubt we will ever know.
